items.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s pay hits a record $96.5 million—he got a 22% pay rise mirroring the $4 trillion tech giant’s skyrocketing shares
items.description: Satya Nadella’s pay hits its highest since becoming Microsoft CEO, driven by a 23% stock surge in 2025 and shares doubling in three years.

items.title: Ivory Coast Gen Zers run low on patience as 83-year-old president runs for fourth term
items.description: More than three-quarters of the West African country's population is under 35.

items.title: Deadly floods in Mexico that killed 76 people trigger a 5-mile oil spill that could ripple through the gulf economy
items.description: The Pantepec River, where the spill occured, supplies water for a number of communities.

items.title: Walmart is determined to win the Thanksgiving meal value wars with a $40 dinner for 10 people
items.description: The Butterball turkey is at its lowest price since 2019, Walmart U.S. president and CEO John Furner said.

items.title: Apple is ‘drastically’ cutting iPhone Air production, report says, after new survey reveals ‘virtually no demand’
items.description: Production of the iPhone Air, starting next month, will be "less than 10% of the volume compared with September."
